page.title: 12Hunting around Dulverton
page.content: { Hunting}is a field sport. In this area there are both{Staghunting}and{ {Foxhunting.}On a Hunting morning the lorry takes the {horses }and {hounds} to the meet which is usually around 11:00 a.m. The hounds are hunted by the{Masters,}the {Huntsmen}and { {Whippers-In. { }In staghunting the {Harbourer}will first pick a likely stag to hunt by finding where it lies up at night. About ten hounds,known as{tufters,}are first put onto the scent of the stag. Later the rest of the hounds will join the hunt, followed by the field on horseback and landrovers and motorbikes. The {Kennelman}has plenty of work to do, visiting the farms to collect dead sheep and cows. The hounds need plenty of meat to keep them fit for hunting.
